creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: monkey hanging from branch; snow on branches
inscription: LE: [Meiwa(?) 7th year, year of the Tiger, Spring]
medium: ink and light color on silk
text: Maruyama Ōkyo founded the Maruyama school of art and based his works on direct observation of nature, giving them a distinct realism. Ōkyo’s keen eye is obvious in the firm grip of the monkey’s paws and the wrinkles around the monkey’s eyes, which gives an intensity to its gaze.
title: Monkey Hanging from a Branch
